Articles.Content:
At various times in history, aircraft, usually military types, have been designed with the capability to land on "unimproved" runways or ones that are paved but have some damage.

Is it possible to land on the KSC runway after it's been damaged?
If by aircraft you include helicopters, then yes they could land quite easily.
As this is not really a challenge, but is a gameplay question, I'll move it from challenges to gameplay questions

In my experience, it depends on 3 factors: aircraft stability, landing speed, and wheel positioning. I have personally landed some of my more stable planes on a broken runway, but when I start to use large planes with less stability, I get explosions. Also, I think of it a lot like landing in the rockier areas of Kerbin. When I land in rocky areas, I need to land slow, so my breaks can kick in and I stop quickly. That is the same with landing on a broken runway. Also, as is true for any landing, wheel positioning is important, and wider wheels near COM really help. 

To paraphrase, I have landed on the KSP runway when it was broken, but only with a slow landing speed, and a stable plane

Hope this helps!

Call me crazy but wouldn't it be easier to just land over in the grass?

Or are we just doing it for the sheer challenge it presents?

I've always reverted whenever I damaged the runway so I've never tried honestly.

Land in the grass beside the runway, then taxi onto whatever part of it looks least likely to give problems.
Or use the Landertron mod to come to a quick stop.
Dragchutes and retrothrusters. Design for it and you can roll to a stop within milliseconds of touchdown.
